article.headline: Fresno State 54, SMU 53
article.story: FRESNO, Calif. (AP) -- Marcus West scored 17 points and Shantay Legans added 15 as Fresno State held off Southern Methodist 54-53 Thursday. SMU guard Bryan Hopkins missed an off-balance 3-pointer at the buzzer. Hopkins led the Mustangs (7-5, 1-1 Western Athletic) with 16 points and six assists. Fresno State (7-5, 3-0) led almost the entire game until two free throws by Eric Castro gave SMU a 50-48 lead with 2:43 left. Following a 3-point play by Mustafa Al-Sayyad, Legans swished a 3-pointer with the shot clock nearly expired to put Fresno State ahead 54-50 with 59 seconds left. But Hopkins answered right back, hitting a 3-pointer with 40.5 left to pull the Mustangs within one. After the Bulldogs drained almost the entire 35-second clock without scoring, SMU took possession at midcourt with 4 seconds left. Hopkins collected the ball off the inbounds pass, dribbled into the front court and launched a hurried three-pointer that grazed the back rim. Patrick Simpson added 15 points for SMU, which shot 38.3 percent from the field. Fresno State shot 38.5 percent. Terry Pettis added 10 points and five assists for the Bulldogs. Fresno State led 11-0 early until the Mustangs got their first points on two Kris Lowe free throws with 14:12 left in the first half.
